toc_entry.title: The Cancer Belt
toc_entry.description: In the southeast corner of Texas, more people get cancer than anywhere else in the state. Why?

toc_entry.title: The Mistress And the Muscleman
toc_entry.description: A tale of passion in the double-knit aristocracy.

toc_entry.title: The Subway That Ate Houston
toc_entry.description: The most expensive, amazing, dynamic, futuristic, and sexy way not to solve a transit crisis.

toc_entry.title: Champs
toc_entry.description: It is whether you win. And these eight Texans are winners.

toc_entry.title: Extreme Unctuousness
toc_entry.subtitle: Health
toc_entry.description: Without embalming you can have a simple, inexpensive funeral. That’s just what Texas morticians don’t want.

toc_entry.title: Bass Hit
toc_entry.subtitle: Jazz
toc_entry.description: For twenty years Texas-born Gene Ramey was in demand as one of the swingingest rhythm bassists in Kansas City, New York, and stops in between.

toc_entry.title: Wail, Croon, And Thrum
toc_entry.subtitle: Popular Music
toc_entry.description: Small-label recordings prove that whether Texans are singing ballads, blues, or punk, they make their best music at home.

toc_entry.title: Buddha In Boots
toc_entry.subtitle: Church
toc_entry.description: A chant-happy Buddhist sect puts on a dazzling pageant in praise of the Texas cowboy. Pastor Barry Bailey lives up to his reputation as a bulwark of Fort Worth Methodism.

toc_entry.title: The Lion Sleeps
toc_entry.subtitle: Film
toc_entry.description: Lion in the Desert is like a breath of hot air. In Death Hunt, the Mounties take forever to get their man. Nighthawks never takes flight. In The Last Metro, Truffaut’s film about wartime Paris, he plays it a little too safe. The Postman Always Rings Twice doesn’t ring true.

toc_entry.title: A Good Catch
toc_entry.subtitle: Dining Out
toc_entry.description: Schrenkeisens’ is so elegant you’ll think you’re in the big city, but the fish is so fresh you know you’re on the coast. Ninfa’s runs thirteen Mexican restaurants across Texas, and amazingly, they can all cook.

toc_entry.title: THE Roar Of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: Moon over El Paso; tea and symphony; the terminal men.

toc_entry.title: Touts
toc_entry.description: On the ball and off the wall.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to entertainment and events of more than usual interest.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: Studying the hard truths of Dallas politics; learning the ropes as a commercial diver; teaching kids to think; remembering the lessons of the oil patch.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Fines for political signs; big changes in the Valley; Ut bursting at the seams; the failure of consultants; Arlington, an unlikely newspaper town.
